Package it.polimi.ingsw.Client.GUI

Class MainWindowController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.GUI.WindowController
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.GUI.MainWindowController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainWindowController
extends WindowController
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Main GUI controller. Controls everything that the others don't.

    • buttonClicked

      void buttonClicked​(javafx.event.Event event)
      Fired when, during builder position selection, a button is clicked to position a builder. Positions a temporary builder image on the cell and communicates the coordinates to the server. Has no effect if the game is not in an initialization state (and in fact doesn't get called, since it gets unbound).
      Parameters:
      event - click event

    • clearAvailableParts

      private void clearAvailableParts()
      Clears up building parts.

      private boolean setStateChoiceDialog​(java.lang.String opt1, java.lang.String opt2)
      Spawns choice dialog to choose between different possible turn options.
      Parameters:
      opt1 - option 1
      opt2 - option 2
      Returns:
      true if option 1 was chosen, false otherwise

    • setChoiceDialog

      private boolean setChoiceDialog​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String header, java.lang.String text, java.lang.String opt1, java.lang.String opt2, ClientState c)
      Spawns generic choice dialog with 2 options.
      Parameters:
      title - Title of the dialog
      header - Header text.
      text - Content text.
      opt1 - option 1
      opt2 - option 2
      c - Optional current clientState.
      Returns:
      true if option 1 was chosen, false otherwise

      Parameters:

      type - type of the object

    • getRow

      private static int getRow​(javafx.scene.Node node)
      Safely returns gridPane row on which the node is. NB: There's a bug in JavaFX where the GridPane.getRowIndex(Node) function will randomly throw if the row index of the node is 0. Hence, the function will return 0 as a row index both in case the index is actually 0 and in case the node isn't inside the pane.
      Parameters:
      node - node whose row relative to gridPaneMain need to be found.
      Returns:
      int containing row of the node, or 0 in case an exception is thrown.

    • getColumn

      private static int getColumn​(javafx.scene.Node node)
      Parameters:
      node - node whose column relative to gridPaneMain need to be found.
      Returns:
      int containing column of the node, or 0 in case an exception is thrown.
      See Also:
      getRow(Node)

    • dragReleased

      void dragReleased​(javafx.scene.input.DragEvent event)
      Fired when a dragged object gets released. If the object has been dragged onto a valid cell, it informs the server as needed.
      Parameters:
      event - drag released (finished) event

      Parameters:

      header - header content
      message - message content

    • dragOver

      void dragOver​(javafx.scene.input.DragEvent event)

      Parameters:
      event - drag over event
